Package camzup.core

Class CurveEntity2

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Entity
camzup.core.Entity2
camzup.core.CurveEntity2
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEntity, IUtils, java.lang.Iterable<Curve2>
public class CurveEntity2
extends Entity2
implements java.lang.Iterable<Curve2>
An entity which contains a transform that is applied to a list of curves. The curves may references a list of materials by index.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    java.util.List<Curve2> curves
    The list of curves held by the entity.
    java.util.List<MaterialSolid> materials
    The list of materials held by the entity.

    • eval

      public Vec2 eval​(int curveIndex, float step, Vec2 coordWorld, Vec2 tanWorld)
      Evaluates a step in the range [0.0, 1.0] for curve, returning a coordinate on the curve and a tangent. The tangent will be normalized, to be of unit length.
      Parameters:
      curveIndex - the curve index
      step - the step in [0.0, 1.0]
      coordWorld - the output world coordinate
      tanWorld - the output world tangent
      Returns:
      the world coordinate
      See Also:
      eval(int, float, Vec2, Vec2, Vec2, Vec2)

    • eval

      public Vec2 eval​(int curveIndex, float step, Vec2 coordWorld, Vec2 tanWorld, Vec2 coordLocal, Vec2 tanLocal)
      Evaluates a step in the range [0.0, 1.0] for curve, returning a coordinate on the curve and a tangent. The tangent will be normalized, to be of unit length.
      Parameters:
      curveIndex - the curve index
      step - the step in [0.0, 1.0]
      coordWorld - the output world coordinate
      tanWorld - the output world tangent
      coordLocal - the output local coordinate
      tanLocal - the output local tangent
      Returns:
      the world coordinate
      See Also:
      Curve2.eval(float, Vec2, Vec2), Transform2.mulPoint(Transform2, Vec2, Vec2), Transform2.mulDir(Transform2, Vec2, Vec2)

    • toBlenderCode

      public java.lang.String toBlenderCode()
      Returns a String of Python code targeted toward the Blender 2.8x API. This code is brittle and is used for internal testing purposes, i.e., to compare how curve geometry looks in Blender (the control) vs. in the library (the test).
      Returns:
      the string

    • toObjString

      public java.lang.String toObjString​(int precision)
      Creates a string representing a Wavefront OBJ file. Renders the curve as a series of line segments.
      Parameters:
      precision - the decimal place precision
      Returns:
      the string

      Creates a string representing a group node in the SVG format.
      Returns:
      the string
